summary:
Premium West Coast apartments.
Search, view, tour, relax.
narrative: Bringing creativity to technology for a leader in luxury rentals.

hero.alt_text: Interior shot of a Prometheus apartment

slides.alt_text: Before and after screenshots of prometheusapartments.com
grafs: We brought Prometheus's web presence to life: new look, new features, and a sophisticated administrative backend.
Prometheus is the largest privately owned multifamily developer in the San Francisco Bay Area. Their portfolio includes dozens of properties in the Bay Area, Portland, and Seattle.

These are no garden-variety apartments. Constructed with a curator's eye, they apply a boutique design sensibility, while committing to a larger sense of community. They needed a web site consistent with those high standards.

slides.alt_text: Desktop and mobile screenshots of a Prometheus web page
grafs: Prometheus needed a world-class, immersive experience that would best serve the goal of lead generation. The site is replete with bold photography, both to highlight the design touches and to give the user a truer feel for the properties.

A comprehensive responsive image strategy was employed to keep the site highly performant across all devices without sacrificing visual impact. A super-fast CDN serves images sized and art-directed appropriately for the user's screen.

slides.alt_text: Prometheus property search results page with interactive map
grafs: Apartment hunters know what they want. Any search functionality needs to balance a robust tool set, a visually engaging experience, location awareness, and minimal clutter.

The result was an Airbnb-style interface that checked all the boxes: predictive natural-language search, filter/sort options, image-rich results, a clear information hierarchy, and two-way interactivity with a map. Responsive across all devices.

slides.alt_text: Custom CMS allows a user to art direct photography used on the site
grafs: In order to facilitate easy maintenance of the site, we designed and developed a custom CMS. A bespoke approach meant we could include sophisticated features such as precision control of image weighting for responsive display on the customer-facing web site.

slides.alt_text: Screenshot of an interactive tour scheduler for a property
grafs: For many apartment sites, lead generation ends with a catch-all email address.

Prometheus takes it a step further. We implemented a tour scheduler with real-time appointment availability, providing more qualified prospective renters with an easy-to-use tool for seeing a property up close.

summary: Smart investing: telling the story, and providing the tools.
narrative: Helping a premier asset management company speak to all their audiences.

hero.alt_text: Abstract photo of a financial chart

slides.alt_text: Screenshots of the new public site and investor portal
grafs: We partnered with Balyasny Asset Management to reassert their unified brand voice, while applying it to different customer experiences.

BAM, an international asset management company, wanted a more modern expression of their brand online. But how to speak to customers, prospective investors, and potential employees using the same voice?

slides.alt_text: Image of Careers page on the BAM public site
grafs: BAM's public marketing site and members-only investor portal are unified by a consistent look and voice, echoing the firm's brand promises: balance, reliability, collaboration, growth.

In particular, the investor portal demonstrates BAM's commitment to providing utility to its customers. Features like watermarked documents benefit the investor with a personalized experience, and contribute to BAM's overall security protocol.

slides.alt_text: Document download page from the investor portal
grafs: BAM uses AWS as a repository for hundreds of secure financial documents, with no native system of categorization.
We implemented a naming convention to enable document searching and filtering on the front end without upending BAM's normal workflow.
An extra layer of authentication was also added to mask the location of secure documents and ensure requests were originating from valid investors only.

summary: The hottest restaurants and dishes never looked so good.
narrative: Connecting the "Anti-Yelp"s legacy systems to the modern world.

hero.alt_text: Overhead view of a restaurant table

grafs: ChefsFeed required quick turnaround on a major rebranding project.
Along with the new look and feel came new features for the web site. It all had to be done within just a few weeks - and it had to tie into legacy systems.
We hit the ground running, came in on time and under budget, and were then hired to add enhancements over the next several months.

slides.alt_text: Before and after screenshots of the ChefsFeed web site
grafs: Code Refactory was brought in for new development to integrate with ChefsFeed's existing legacy and 3rd-party systems.
The initial round of work included a new web site built from the ground up as well as updates to an existing, proprietary CMS.

slides.alt_text: ChefsFeed featured on Best New Apps in the Apple App Store
grafs: Following a successful deployment, our engagement with ChefsFeed was extended.
We added enhancements to the web site to address evolving business needs; we continued to add capabilities to the CMS; and we took on a senior-level role advising development on an iOS native app.
In addition, Code Refactory spearheaded advertising integration for static and video ads resulting in new opportunities for ChefsFeed revenue.
